event.title: was originally founded by Captain James Stirling in 1829

data.event: Perth was originally founded by Captain James Stirling in 1829 as the administrative centre of the Swan River Colony.

event.title: vested in the smaller City of Perth) in 1856

data.event: It gained city status (currently vested in the smaller City of Perth) in 1856, and was promoted to the status of a Lord Mayorality in 1929.

event.title: was promoted to the status of a Lord Mayorality in 1929

data.event: It gained city status (currently vested in the smaller City of Perth) in 1856, and was promoted to the status of a Lord Mayorality in 1929.

event.title: several mining booms in the late 20th and early 21st centuries

data.event: This was followed by a surge in economic activity flowing from several mining booms in the late 20th and early 21st centuries that saw Perth become the regional headquarters for a number of large mining operations located around the state.
